abstract: PepsiCo will raise prices on some Gatorade sports drinks and Frito-Lay snacks to help offset higher commodity costs; reports third-quarter profit of $2 billion, or $1.25 per share, from $1.92 billion, or $1.19 per share, in year-ago quarter; revenue rose to $17.58 billion from $15.51 billion.
snippet: The increases, on top of others made earlier this year, are helping the company stand by its full-year earnings growth target.
lead_paragraph: The increases, on top of others made earlier this year, are helping the company stand by its full-year earnings growth target.

headline.main: PepsiCo Plans Higher Prices for Snacks
headline.print_headline: PepsiCo Plans Higher Prices For Snacks
headline.seo: PepsiCo Plans Higher Prices on Drinks and Snacks
